actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services

official_title: A bill to amend chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, to modify service requirements relating to creditable service with congressional campaign committees.

summary.text: Amends Federal law to reduce from five years to four years and six months as of December 12, 1980, the minimum length of a congressional employee's service with one or more specified congressional campaign committees necessary for it to qualify as creditable service for retirement purposes.

titles.title: A bill to amend chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, to modify service requirements relating to creditable service with congressional campaign committees.
